an8.81:4.1: “Mendicants, when there is no mindfulness and situational awareness, one who lacks mindfulness and situational awareness has destroyed a vital condition for conscience and prudence.
an8.81:4.2: When there is no conscience and prudence, one who lacks conscience and prudence has destroyed a vital condition for sense restraint.
an8.81:4.3: When there is no sense restraint, one who lacks sense restraint has destroyed a vital condition for ethical conduct.
an8.81:4.4: When there is no ethical conduct, one who lacks ethics has destroyed a vital condition for right samādhi.
an8.81:4.5: When there is no right samādhi, one who lacks right samādhi has destroyed a vital condition for true knowledge and vision.
an8.81:4.6: When there is no true knowledge and vision, one who lacks true knowledge and vision has destroyed a vital condition for disillusionment and dispassion.
an8.81:4.7: When there is no disillusionment and dispassion, one who lacks disillusionment and dispassion has destroyed a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.
an8.81:4.8: Suppose there was a tree that lacked branches and foliage.
an8.81:4.9: Its shoots, bark, softwood, and heartwood would not grow to fullness.
an8.81:4.12: In the same way, when there is no mindfulness and situational awareness, one who lacks mindfulness and situational awareness has destroyed a vital condition for conscience and prudence.
an8.81:4.13: When there is no conscience and prudence …
an8.81:4.14: One who lacks disillusionment and dispassion has destroyed a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.
an8.81:5.1: When there is mindfulness and situational awareness, one who has fulfilled mindfulness and situational awareness has fulfilled a vital condition for conscience and prudence.
an8.81:5.2: When there is conscience and prudence, a person who has fulfilled conscience and prudence has fulfilled a vital condition for sense restraint.
an8.81:5.3: When there is sense restraint, one who has sense restraint has fulfilled a vital condition for ethical conduct.
an8.81:5.4: When there is ethical conduct, one who has fulfilled ethical conduct has fulfilled a vital condition for right samādhi.
an8.81:5.5: When there is right samādhi, one who has fulfilled right samādhi has fulfilled a vital condition for true knowledge and vision.
an8.81:5.6: When there is true knowledge and vision, one who has fulfilled true knowledge and vision has fulfilled a vital condition for disillusionment and dispassion.
an8.81:5.7: When there is disillusionment and dispassion, one who has fulfilled disillusionment and dispassion has fulfilled a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.
an8.81:5.8: Suppose there was a tree that was complete with branches and foliage.
an8.81:5.9: Its shoots, bark, softwood, and heartwood would grow to fullness.
an8.81:5.12: In the same way, when there is mindfulness and situational awareness, one who has fulfilled mindfulness and situational awareness has fulfilled a vital condition for conscience and prudence.
an8.81:5.13: When there is conscience and prudence …
an8.81:5.14: One who has fulfilled disillusionment and dispassion has fulfilled a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.”
